People do whatever they think will make the world a better place

I believe very strongly that, whatever the ethical framework to which a human has been subjected, in the depth of their heart they will want to do what they think will make the world a better place.

As an superminority1, I do well to remember this. It helps me better navigate social contexts in which people might do or say things that are unintendedly harmful. For me, this maxim invokes the atmosphere of first learning about Standpoint theory in university, of reading Kimberl√© Crenshaw‚Äôs work on Intersectionality . Everybody is their own intersection, some are very different from mine, and that‚Äôs okay.

When I say this to myself, I don‚Äôt do so to justify harmful behavior, but to better frame the conversation I may be having around it.
